item.title: Resident Evil Village, Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth, Darkest Dungeon II and More Join PS Plus Extra Catalog for January 2026
item.content:encoded:
After several of the titles joining the PS Plus Extra and Premium game catalogues leaked yesterday evening, PlayStation has officially confirmed all of the games that PS Plus Extra and Premium tier subscribers will be getting access to for January 2026, including Resident Evil Village, Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth, and Darkest Dungeon II.

Resident Evil Village and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth are easily the two headlining titles for this month, which adds a total of eight games for PS Plus Extra subscribers. PS Plus Premium subscribers get an additional ninth title with Ridge Racer from the original PlayStation console, joining the Classics Catalog, which is exclusively available to those at the top subscription tier.

Other notable inclusions in this month's batch are A Quiet Place: The Road Ahead, the spin-off survival game of the popular horror film franchise. A Little to the Left, the cozy puzzle game from indie developer Max Inferno, and Expeditions: A MudRunner Game.

Once again, players paying top-dollar for the Premium subscription only get one game added to the Classics Catalog, which seems to continue a trend of Premium subscribers seemingly getting the short end of the stick.

That's not to say anything against Ridge Racer, more to say that while yes, Premium subscribers are also paying for the other games joining the Extra and Essential tiers each month, the Classics Catalog is one of the only key differences between Premium and the other tiers. Some months, no games enter the Classics Catalog. It simply has to leave those players wondering what they're paying for, if they can't expect the library of Classic games to actually grow at a reasonable rate.

Regardless, here is the full list of games coming to PS Plus Extra and Premium for January 2026, all of which will be available starting January 20, 2026:

  • Resident Evil Village (PS5, PS4)
  • Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth (PS5, PS4)
  • Expeditions: A MudRunner Game (PS5, PS4)
  • A Quiet Place: The Road Ahead (PS5)
  • Darkest Dungeon II (PS5, PS4)
  • The Exit 8 (PS5, PS4)
  • Art of Rally (PS5, PS4)
  • A Little to the Left (PS5, PS4)
  • Ridge Racer (PS5, PS4) - Premium-tier subscribers only

Earlier this month, PS Plus Essential subscribers (and every other tier of PS Plus subscribers) got to add Need for Speed Unbound, Epic Mickey Rebrushed, and Core Keeper to their lineup.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/ps-plus-extra-premium-resident-evil-village-january-2026/

item.title: PlayStation 5 Pro PSSR 2.0 Is Allegedly Launching Between January and March, Delivering ‘Higher Resolution For Classic Games’
item.content:encoded:
• 0-20%: Unlikely - Lacks credible sources
  • 21-40%: Questionable - Some concerns remain
  • 41-60%: Plausible - Reasonable evidence
  • 61-80%: Probable - Strong evidence
  • 81-100%: Highly Likely - Multiple reliable sources

Despite being the most powerful console on the market, the PlayStation 5 Pro hasn't made a huge splash following its launch in November 2024, as users felt its power was left underutilized and some of its unique features, such as the AI-powered PSSR upscaler, left something to be desired, especially in its first incarnation which failed to deliver significant image quality improvements, often delivering visual glitches instead.

While it remains to be seen if any game launching this year, such as the highly anticipated Marvel's Wolverine, will take full advantage of the system's power, by March, the system is reportedly getting a much-welcome upgrade that promises to deliver significant image quality and performance improvements, and a few surprises.

Earlier this week, Gust_FAN, a reliable Japanese insider who previously correctly revealed the PlayStation 5 Slim redesign and, more recently, the launch of the Hyperpop Collection, shared new information on PSSR 2.0 on X, which we have known to be in development since last year. The user revealed when the new version of the upscaler will launch, how it will improve the performance of certain games, and more, as summarized below:

  • Update will be available between January and March.
  • Features similar to FSR 4 will be implemented on PS5 Pro.
  • Improved image quality and performance.
  • Increased frame rates for games that previously sat at 70-80 FPS.
  • Higher resolution for classic low-resolution games.
  • New debugging tools will also be available for developers.

While most of the new information revealed by the Japanese insider isn't specifically new, the corroboration of the launch window suggests it won't be much longer until we see how games that previously sat at 70-80 FPS will run, and if the new version of the upscaler will bring the system closer to being a proper 4K resolution, 120 FPS machine.

Particularly interesting is also the fact that classic low-resolution games will run at higher resolutions, which could make classic games on the PlayStation Store and more expensive PlayStation Plus subscriptions more enticing.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/playstation-5-pro-pssr-2-0-is-allegedly-launching-between-january-and-march-delivering-higher-resolution-for-classic-games/
